distribution.text: Copyright 2023 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
SMT was updated to version 3.0.38.

Following security issue was fixed:

- CVE-2018-12472: Harden hostname check during sibling check by forcing double
  reverse lookup (bsc#1104076)

Following non security issues were fixed:

- Add migration path check when registration sharing is enabled
- Fix sibling sync errors (bsc#1111056):
  - Synchronize all registered products
  - Handle duplicate registrations when syncing
  - Force resync to the sibling instance in `upgrade` and
    `synchronize` API calls
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: CSAF 2.0 data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: A improper authentication using the HOST header in SUSE Linux SMT allows remote attackers to spoof a sibling server. Affected releases are SUSE Linux SMT: versions prior to 3.0.37.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
